reviews.text: Bed was really uncomfortable, obviously needs replacing. As staying for four nights this was a sore point. Room clean and large. Plenty of parking nearby if you find the spaces outside full. Reception helpful with our additional requests for bedding and tea/milk. Next door is a pub that provided an excellent mid week evening meal although this was normal pub grub type. Would not recommend you have the Sunday lunchtime carvery though, stick to the menu items. Just up the road ( 5 mins by car) towards Boston is a Morrisons Supermarket and you can get an excellent breakfast or evening meal there. Reception will advise how to get there.
reviews.title: Good for Shops but not for Sleep

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you are taking your dog with you, there is a good walking area by the canal. Again Reception will advise how to get there from the lodge, but it's no more than a five minute walk away. Lift from entrance means it doesn't matter if you are on first or second floor.
reviews.title: Spartan

reviews.text: Clean and in good condition but very spartan, i double bed and one white plastic chair in a double room. £5 extra for wifi and charge for parking in certain hours
reviews.title: Great for shopping.

reviews.text: A very basic hotel,not one that you would want to spend more than one night in.Extremely poor facilities,asked reception for extra pillows ,only to be told that there was none.Vending machine handy for a biscuit for your tea/coffee in the morning.Bed was clean and comfy.Please do not forget to bring toiletries/hairdryer.
reviews.title: A shopper's delight

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Would I stay again,,,,,probably ,,but only because Springfield shopping centre is attached and is simply the best shopping for designer outlets.
reviews.title: nice new basic hotel

reviews.text: Having stayed at many Travelodges in the past on business, I was disappointed with the finish in the room at the Spalding site. In the past the rooms had felt comfortable and homely, however I can only describe the room I stayed in on the 7th as reminiscent of my expections of a room in a young offenders prison. The removal of any artwork and curtains gave the room a stark and depressing feel. The lack of any toiletries and hotel literature again added to this feeling. I had tried your site as it was most convieient to my destination, however in future I would seek another of the budget brands such as Holiday Inn Express or Premier Inn, which offer similar room rates and a far superior finish and level of accommodation.
reviews.title: Where are Travelodge Brand Values?

reviews.text: The room we were given was clean in the main areas, however the edges of carpets and under the bed was dusty and unkept, and the bathroom area was showing signs of wear and some of the grout around the bath was mildew stained. The bed itsself was uncomfortable and the base was tatty. Two thin pillows were supplied and a single extra one was provided on a shelf, however this was stained and a rolled up jumper was used in place of using the second pillow. The staff member who greated us on arrival however was both friendly and warm and made an effort to welcome us. Would I stay again? No, only if no other suitable accommodation was available. Sorry Travelodge you seem to have lost your way with cost saving measures and I fear that your once proud brand is now losing ground to your competitors who just do everything with a bit more flair.
reviews.title: We could take the dog, but not in the shopping centre!

reviews.text: When looking for a house to buy in Spalding we stayed at the Travelodge. We had our Cavalier king charles spaniel with us, so we paid the extra. As we had never been there before we were a bit dismayed that the reception is reached via automatic doors and a lift to the first floor. Not so good when you have to take the lift every time the dog needs to go outside!
reviews.title: Not that bad!!

reviews.text: The room was large and clean and the staff were friendly and helpful. Our problems arose when we went for a walk with the dog around the shopping centre. We didn't expect to take the dog in any of the shops, but we were told dogs weren't allowed in the shopping centre all all, even though it is outside!
reviews.title: Comfortable and clean

reviews.text: Then we tried to get something to eat and found there was nowhere to go that you could take the dog. As you are not allowed to leave dogs in the hotel rooms we were left with leaving her in the car while we ate in Mcdonnalds.
reviews.title: nice room

reviews.text: It was our misfortune to be booked in here, dirty room & filthy bathroom....never again
reviews.title: Terrible

reviews.text: Spent 2 nights here on business and had a lovely pleasant stay. It was comfortable, spacious, warm and very clean. The decor could've done with a little tlc as the white walls had become a little worn down when you looked close. However, it wasn't so bad that it bothered me.
reviews.title: Does what it says on the tin and I really enjoyed my stay.

reviews.text: I like my privacy when I stay somewhere and that's exactly what I got. When not working, I could come back to my room, kick back, watch the tv and relax without any noise or other disturbance. There was tea and coffee making amenities in the room and snacks from reception if I felt peckish. The staff there were great and very helpful. The one lady receptionist even let me put my can of beer in their fridge for when I came in from work.
reviews.title: It is what it is!
Shockingly Bad
reviews.text: I had a few hours to kill in the day but didn't get bored as there was a pub next door serving delicious pub lunch and a mini shopping centre right on the doorstep. There was also a park close by to walk the dog if I had one. All in all it was a really nice, relaxing stay and I don't really know what people have bad to say about the place. I'm back in Spalding next week so have booked to stay there again.
Stayed here for 1 night on business. Typical Travelodge, basic with no frills.
reviews.title: One night stopover

reviews.text: had a lovely overnight stop here.spent lots at retail outlets in the complex.wandered around the festival gardens also part of the complex.had meal in spalding that evening. unfotunately town centre full of groups mainly men.drinking in street though to be fair no problem too us.did get followed to riverside by dodgy character who on turning to face him, smirked and veered off to his resident gutter.would stay here again but use nearby eateries.got the room on ten pound offer but would pay going rate.
reviews.title: Superb location, friendly welcoming staff, room basic but clean.

reviews.text: The staff were fine, however the room had a strong chemical smell so the window had to be kept open (this was in winter). There was a booming sound throughout the night.
reviews.title: A roof over your head - finish!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bed was very low and very uncomfortable.
reviews.title: Not too bad

reviews.text: The room was not very clean (cobwebs above the bed, carpet smelly and badly vacuumed) and the bathroom has seen better days - to get hot water in the bath/shower required a pointed object (such as a biro) in order to get the tap to turn to the hot position as a piece of the tap was missing (apparently a safety feature).
reviews.title: Does what it says on the packet

reviews.text: The car park was free of charge overnight between 18:00 and 09:00, however if late even a minute a £1.00 charge for two hours parking was levied.
reviews.title: Not very spicy
